The incident was reported by the New Zea: MPI) in a news release on February 3, 2021.
The woman: Wenqing (Wendy) Li, pleaded guilty to charges related to two separate but related incidents at the Auckland International Airport and was sentenced to intensive supervision for 12 months and 100 hours of community service.
The MPI regional team manager: Simon Anderson, emphasized that smuggling plants or endangered species into New Zealand is a prosecutable offense and poses a risk to the country's biosecurity.
Evidence of the smuggling attempt was fo: including stockings filled with succulents and a cactus hidden in a garbage can in the men's toilet, as well as unauthorized seeds and plant pots discovered in Li's luggage.
